result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerald C. Livingston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bond and payment made 9/26 applied to fine and costs.  Balance of $174.00 due on or before November 1, 2016.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerald C. Livingston

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant to plead guilty to count 1.  State recommended 1 year probation.  Defendant said they agreed to a fine.  Correction:  $25.00 fine, plus costs.  Defendant wishes to proceed without an attorney.   Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the count he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of domestic disorderly conduct, contrary to 947.01(1).  Court ordered:  $100.00, plus costs.  DNA sample and surcharge.  Pay 1/2 today.  Balance on or before November 1, 2016.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and without counsel.  Defendant accepting offer.  No response from the victim.

Pre-trial conference on September 21, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on September 26, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, without counsel.  Defendant never received an offer from DA's office.  Given to him in court today.  PTC set for 9/21 and STC 9/26 at 3 pm

Pre-trial conference on August 24, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on September 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant plead NG.  Entered by the court.  PTC 8/24 and STC 9/12 at 3 pm.
Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver.  Defendant stated he understood.  Court found that defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to attorney.

Special prosecutor Rebecca Maki-Wallender appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and without counsel.  Defendant wants to proceed without counsel.  Form given to the defendant to complete.

No violent, abusive, threatening or disorderly contact with: A. W.    Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

No violent, abusive, threatening or disorderly contact with: A. W.    Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.

No violent, abusive, threatening or disorderly contact with: A. W.    Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and without counsel.  Defendant had the wrong date.  Warrant quashed.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties.  Court explained his attorney options.  Defendant will contact an attorney.  AIA set for 8/1 at 9 am.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  No other appeararances.  Warrant authorized.  Bond ordered forfeited.
